fields.title: DoseMatic
fields.short: Continuing working on the DoseMatic project. Created module for statistical analysis of acute, protracted and partial doses of radiation detected in blood samples. Additional statistical tools include: calibration function comparison and report generation. Project is almost ready for testing.

fields.short: Presentation of newly obtained preliminary results on kaons produced in Ar+Sc collisions: "Identified hadron production in Ar+Sc collisions at SPS energies". No horn structure in kaon production with dependence on the collision energy is observed.

fields.title: Master thesis defense
fields.short: Thesis title: “Pulser Calibration of Time Projection Chambers in the NA61/SHINE”. The thesis covers the overview of NA61/SHINE strong interactions programme and describes a method of TPC read-out synchronization calibration with a pulser. The results were presented and studies for potential signals of detector ageing.

fields.title: STM Laboratory
fields.short: Studying the surfaces of Mo(211) with layers of oxygen. Results were presented on ICPS in Budapest by Jakub Kwiecień.
fields.body:
Abstract:
The Mo(211) surface was investigated by the scanning tunneling microscope (STM) and low energy electron diffraction (LEED) methods. Growth of Mo2O layer and the surface structure reconstruction has been observed during an increasing of oxygen atoms concentration on the surface.
fields.place: Institute of Experimental Physics, University of Wrocław

fields.title: Populi Sp. z o. o.

My role in the start-up is statistical data analysis and visualization.

"Analysis of identified hadron production in Ar+Sc collisions at beam momenta 13A-150A GeV/c"

fields.title: NA61/SHINE Collaboration Meeting

fields.title: Exicted QCD
fields.short: I gave an invited speech concerning most recent results “On strangeness in NA61/SHINE”.
fields.body:
Abstract:
NA61/SHINE is a fixed target experiment at the CERN Super-Proton-Synchrotron. The main goals of the experiment are to discover the critical point of strongly interacting matter and to study the properties of the onset of deconfinement. In order to reach these goals, a study of hadron production properties is performed in nucleus-nucleus, proton-proton and proton-nucleus interactions as a function of collision energy and size of the colliding nuclei. 
In this talk, I will review recent results on strangeness production in p+p, Be+Be and Ar+Sc collisions in the SPS energy range. Transverse mass spectra, rapidity spectra and mean multiplicities of kaons obtained with various analysis methods will be presented. An overview of statistical and dynamical models of strangeness production in the vicinity of phase transition will be presented as well. Predictions of the models will be compared with available results on heavy-ions collisions and, most importantly, with new results on intermediate mass systems.
